sentences.en: A forward thrust of the pelvis, as in a burlesque striptease.
sentences.cn: 骨盆前突: 脱衣舞中骨盆前突.

sentences.en: By taking bribes the judge made a burlesque of his high office.
sentences.cn: 那位法官受了贿赂,嘲弄了自己的高位.

sentences.en: Crudely or irregularly fashioned verse , often of a humorous or burlesque nature.
sentences.cn: 打油诗多属幽默滑稽之作粗劣或无章法的诗.

sentences.en: He just is a second banana in that burlesque.
sentences.cn: 他只不过是那场滑稽戏里的配角.

sentences.en: I think most of his poems are pieces of burlesque.
sentences.cn: 我认为他的诗中大多数是滑稽讽刺作品.

sentences.en: Our comic play was a burlesque of a Shakespearean tragedy.
sentences.cn: 我们的喜剧是对莎士比亚一出悲剧的讽刺性模仿.

sentences.en: Tell young son: " You see mom and your dad burlesque. "
sentences.cn: 就告诉小儿子: “ 你看妈妈和你爹爹作戏. ”

sentences.en: The book read like a black comic burlesque.
sentences.cn: 这本书读起来像部荒诞可笑的讽刺作品。

sentences.en: The burlesque element weakens the serious portions of the book.
sentences.cn: 书里的戏谑成分使严肃部分受到损害.

sentences.en: These magazines were the most pitiful burlesque stuff that yon could imagine.
sentences.cn: 这些杂志是些拙劣的东西,要多荒唐有多荒唐.

trans.tran_cn: 滑稽模仿，<美>（包括脱衣舞的）滑稽歌舞杂剧
trans.tran_en: a performance involving a mixture of  comedy  and  striptease  , popular in America in the past
